Site safety – hazards onsite (Excavation, traffic, moving plant, etc)
Before You Dig Australia (BYDA) – Check Services
Check Tags on all Leads & Tools
Signed off by Supervisor Attendees (Sign On Screen)
General reporting requirements (Report any concerns etc…to the Site Supervisor).
Reporting of accidents, incidents, injuries and non-conformances (All incidents and accidents/injuries must be reported immediately to the Site Supervisor for investigation)
Environmental requirements – any site specific legislation requirements, waste management, recycling, etc.
Quality requirements – Sydney Water ITP’s, checklists, etc. work and material conform to quality, contract specifications and project specific inspection and testing requirements.
First aid kits location – located in the work vehicle
Work area housekeeping (Work area(s) to be kept clean and tidy at all times – use bins provided)
Emergency Procedures, Emergency exits and Emergency muster point/assembly point (Refer to site emergency plan on page 2.).
Emergency Procedures, Emergency exits and Emergency muster point/assembly point (Refer to site emergency plan on page 2.).
Fire extinguishers and or fire hose reels locations (Refer to site emergency plan on page 2.).
Personal protective equipment (PPE) (Safety footwear e.g. boots, Hi visibility outerwear)
All electrical leads and hand tools tested & checked (All electrical leads to be kept off ground using lead stands)
Industry WHS induction cards (record card number on page 3 and a photo copy shall be retained).
Safe Work Method Statements. (All safe work method statements to be assessed prior to commencement of work)
WHS design issues and risk control measures e.g. Site access, traffic control, storage issues, barricades, signage etc… (Report any issues or concerns to the Project Manager for rectification).
Locations of asbestos registers (All workers on site have access to the asbestos registers).
Asbestos register(s) on this site are located:
Site Security (No person is to remove or dismantle barricades or fence panels without prior authorisation from the Project Manager)
Any special site conditions to be aware of (note below
Have you made any changes in your building procedures for environmental reasons?
Do you plan your site before starting – for access, deliveries, construction areas, waste, stockpiles to minimise waste, and water, air and noise pollution?
Are your customers aware of your commitment to improving the environment?
Are you aware of and do you try to stop dust, spray and fumes from your site?
Are vehicles kept to sealed or dedicated areas?
Is excess spoil placed in skip bins or approved area?
Do you have access roads and work areas watered down or covered?
Do you have stockpiles watered down or covered?
Does your machinery comply to emission standards?
Is equipment in place to minimise odours?
Do you check and maintain your erosion and sediment control measures every day?
Do you have a soil and water management plan for your site?
Do you have erosion and sediment control measures in place before excavation starts and are sediment fences clean and maintained?
Are sediment fences secure and in appropriate locations i.e. downstream of the works, between drainage lines, around stockpiles, stockpiles surrounded on the downslope side?
Do you place overburden upslope as a protective bund?
Are the stormwater drains around your site free of pollution (litter, soil, building materials, etc.) and are the grates protected?
Do you protect all drains with sediment traps that are appropriately sized for the stormwater flow and sediment load?
Do you have a kerbside turf strip to slow the speed of water and trap sediment?
Do you have and use a designated washout area that is isolated from stormwater drains?
Have you retained trees and vegetation and protected them from being damaged?
Do you have a single access point that is stabilised to prevent tracking of sediment onto the road, footpath and gutters?
Do you sweep and shovel all soil, earth, mud, clay and concrete waste from sealed areas every day?
Do you keep all chemicals, fuel and wastes are kept in sealed containers and not in drainage lines?
Do you have erosion control measures preventing sediment from entering waterways?
Are all discharges of chlorinated waters meet the following criteria; < 0.5 mg/L chlorine and pH between 6.5 and 9?
Do you prevent mechanical trenching around trees?
Are trees to be removed clearly identified?
Do you have exclusion fencing is in place?
Do you prevent equipment or stockpiles under tree canopies?
Have you advised residents of the works
Do you have warning signs in place?
Have you met the conditions of any approvals?
Have you ensured that owner’s access is not restricted without prior warning and kept to a minimum?
Do you have and follow a waste minimisation plan?
Do you have separate bins for recyclable and non-recyclable materials
Do you separate any of your wastes (items for reuse, return, recycling)?
Are skip bins are provided for excess spoil and waste materials
The site is in an orderly state
Is your waste in an area where it cannot contaminate or pollute the stormwater drains if it rains or if there is a storm?
Does your site use hand-trigger hoses to stop water wastage?
Does all your plant and equipment comply with EPA Guidelines?
Stationary and mobile equipment is fitted with residential type silencers
Do you regularly check and maintain noisy equipment (e.g. compressors, grinders and generators)?
Are you aware of the effects of noise on your neighbours?
Do your work hours comply with Council & EPA regulations?
Are you taking steps to minimise noise?
Do you clean up all spills immediately?
Do you avoid the use of chemicals that could harm your health?
Are you aware of the correct procedures for removing lead paint and asbestos?
Have disturbed areas been compacted, except for the top 10 cm?
Have all grass verges and driveways have restored to original condition?
Have any of your materials or equipment been left on site?
Do your sediment control measures remain in unstabilised areas?
Have temporary access tracks have been restored?
